text: Left-wing populism, also called social populism, is a political ideology that is a combination of left-wing politics with populist. They believe in anti- elitism, are against the Establishment and speak for the "common people".Albertazzi and McDonnell, p. 123. They support ideas that are economic democracy, social justice, and anti-globalization. They are also against capitalism and military intervention. ==References== Category:Political movements
title: Left-wing populism
